summary: mark clattenburg will take charge of the manchester derby on sunday . the english referee sent off vincent kompany for belgium against israel . tyler blackcett and luke shaw have also been sent off for united . clattenburg will be joined by assistants simon beck and jake collin . jonathan moss will serve as the fourth official at old trafford .

aspect: 1. Referee Mark Clattenburg is appointed for the Manchester derby despite having sent off three players from both United and City.
2. City captain Vincent Kompany is suspended for the match against Wales due to a red card in a Euro 2016 qualifier match.
3. Clattenburg has received criticism for favoring United in the past, but this season, he has only shown two red cards, both to United players.
explain: Mark Clattenburg will be the referee for the Manchester derby despite having sent off three players from Manchester United and Manchester City in previous games, reflecting the trust in his decision-making abilities.</s>

Manchester City captain Vincent Kompany is suspended for the upcoming match against Wales as he received a red card in a Euro 2016 qualifier match. Mark Clattenburg, renowned English referee, will officiate the Manchester derby with assistants Simon Beck and Jake Collin. Jonathan Moss will take the position of fourth official at Old Trafford. Moreover, Tyler Blackcett and Luke Shaw have been sent off for their teams.### Response: 
Vincent Kompany will miss Manchester City's match against Wales due to receiving a red card in a Euro 2016 qualifier match, and Mark Clattenburg will officiate the Manchester derby with assistants Simon Beck and Jake Collin, with Jonathan Moss serving as fourth official at Old Trafford. Additionally, Tyler Blackcett and Luke Shaw have been sent off for their teams.</s>

The core idea of this aspect is that despite criticisms of Clattenburg favoring Manchester United in the past, he has only shown two red cards this season, both for United players.
